intro: Gaultheria albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered wintergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the temperate regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its low-growing shrub form, with glossy evergreen leaves and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. It produces small, red, edible berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Gaultheria albiflora thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or forested areas.
